title: Oregon Territory Outfitters Offers Shuttles and Logistics for The Oregon Timber Trail
content:
There’s something rumbling on the forested flanks of Mt Hood in the beautiful state of Oregon. It’s a new beginning for Oregonian Cedar Coast Kyes as he recently started an Outfitter/Guide/Shuttle service based out of ZigZag. The newly formed Oregon Territory Outfitters is located a stone’s throw from the ZigZag Ranger Station on the Western slope of Mt Hood…
Oregon Territory Outfitters (OTO) offers guided rides in the Mt Hood National Forest and operates under a special use permit from the United States Forest Service. With a strong focus on Bikepacking, OTO provides introductory overnight adventures as well as a longer multi-day excursion called “The Hood Loop”.

This new Bikepacking Route takes riders around the base of majestic Mt Hood for an up close and personal experience as you wind your way around the mountain on luxuriously paved deep-forest roads, world-class singletrack trails, and some dreamy dirt and gravel roads.

Providing all bikes, bags, and specialty bikepacking gear, OTO offers an incredibly approachable experience for folks looking to get into bikepacking. Partnering with some of the most reputable bike/gear/bag brands in the world, they have a thoughtfully curated selection of bikepacking equipment available for demo and purchase.

Oregon Territory Outfitters also provides shuttle and logistics service for the more seasoned adventurers as they tackle the The Oregon Timber Trail. From dropoff and pickup for folks looking to tackle the whole 700 mile route or those looking to bite off a little section at a time, OTO can help get you way out there and back again. For more information, check out the Oregon Timber Trail.

Oregon Territory Outfitters also provides some of the most amazing Mountain Biking and Gravel Riding experiences imaginable. These day trips provide some of the best riding and the most breathtaking views in the Mt Hood area. With new trips being added regularly and custom trips always available, there is truly something for everyone at Oregon Territory Outfitters.

Located just east of Portland, Oregon – OTO is highly accessible to anyone in the region and there is easy access from PDX or Union Station via public transportation that will drop you right at their doorstep.

The best way to get in touch is through the website or direct messaging through Instagram.
